title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
xwikibot joined #xwiki at 11:39  
rrodriguez left at 11:40 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
vmassol - (11:45): evalica: how hard would it be to implement the skin for http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Improvements/XWikiOrgProposal2 ? Was there an agreement about using it (I don't recall)?  
vmassol - (11:47): sburjan: hello. Do we have documentation for Template Providers on xwiki.org?  
vmassol - (11:47): (or jvdrean)  
vmassol - (11:48): found it: http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Applications/AdministrationApplication  
evalica - (11:48): vmassol: I don't have experience in "customer support" I don't know how hard it is ...  
jvelociter - (11:48): vmassol: strange  
jvelociter - (11:48): let me see what's happening  
jvelociter - (11:49): (not very slow for me BTW)  
sburjan - (11:50): vmassol: you mean Easy Templates Creation and Administration ?  
\_melvin\_ - (11:51): Hello. After upgrading from 2.0 to 2.5 Log with mod\_jk gives Error: Login Cookie Validation hash mismatch. I tryed several jkoptions but without success.  Can anybody help?  
vmassol - (11:51): yes found it  
vmassol - (11:52): lunch bbl

vmassol - (12:38): back  
vmassol - (12:55): thanks mflorea  
mflorea - (12:55): vmassol: np, was my mistake after all ;)  
vmassol - (12:56): still nice that you fixed it quickly  
mflorea - (12:58): :)  
jstoldt left at 13:02 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds

vmassol - (13:17): we need a release manager for XE 2.7...  
vmassol left at 13:30 (Quit: Leaving.

venkatna joined #xwiki at 14:04  
venkatna left at 14:05 (Remote host closed the connection  
silviar1 joined #xwiki at 14:22  
silviar left at 14:24 (Ping timeout: 260 seconds  
sburjan - (14:31): Guys, I am logged on xwiki.org and I can't even access http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ .Is this due to migration ?  
cjdelisle - (14:32): permissions are wrong, any attempt to fix is reverted daily.  
vmassol - (14:32): sburjan: afaik we haven't touched at playground  
vmassol - (14:33): cjdelisle: indeed playground is reset daily. Maybe the perm were set wrong in the db backup that is reset daily  
sburjan - (14:33): well I know that I don't have full permission on .org, but afaik playground should be accessible  
vmassol - (14:33): we can fix that when we uprade xwiki.org to 2.6. Can someone fix the perm manually for now?  
sburjan - (14:33): no, no need  
sburjan - (14:34): I was just wondering why I don't have access  
vmassol - (14:34): jvelociter: do you have some time today to finish the xwiki.org upgrade?  
vmassol - (14:34): sburjan: it needs to be fixed asap  
vmassol - (14:34): sburjan: are you registered on playground?  
jvelociter - (14:34): vmassol: yes should be able to find the time  
jvelociter - (14:34): there is not too much left to do  
sburjan - (14:35): I'm not. I go to .org, login, then click on the playground from panel  
vmassol - (14:35): sburjan: you need to register every time since the db is reset every day on playground....  
vmassol - (14:35): that's probably why  
vmassol - (14:35): sburjan: and you read the home page?  
vmassol - (14:35): :)  
sburjan - (14:35): nop  
vmassol - (14:35): well do  
sburjan - (14:35): I get an epic : You are not allowed to view this document or perform this action.  
vmassol - (14:35): hmm that's not normal  
vmassol - (14:35): it should be ok in view  
sburjan - (14:36): odd thing. I go to .org main, logout, and click on playground, and it works  
sburjan - (14:36): it's like permissions aren't inherited  
vmassol - (14:36): sburjan: strange I can view http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome when I'm logged out  
vmassol - (14:36): it's maybe because you're logged in with your xwiki.org creds  
vmassol - (14:36): they aren't  
vmassol - (14:37): let me check them  
sburjan - (14:37): oh, so playground isnt part of the .org XEM ?  
vmassol - (14:37): it is but we wanted users to log on it I think  
vmassol - (14:37): I think we didn't want people to register on xwiki.org jsut to try the playground  
sburjan - (14:38): yeah.. makes sense  
vmassol - (14:38): indeed I've checked and only local users have view rights  
vmassol - (14:38): we should at least allow view rights to others too  
sburjan - (14:38): but atm this seems to block registered users to go to playground  
vmassol - (14:38): I'll fix this  
sburjan - (14:38): great  
vmassol - (14:40): xwik.org is so slow...  
vmassol - (14:41): take a minute to click on a right button (at least)  
sburjan - (14:41): go we use Google Analytics for .org ? If we do, who has the account ?  
sburjan - (14:41): \*do  
vmassol - (14:41): we do  
vmassol - (14:41): several of us have access  
sburjan - (14:41): maybe it's because huge trafific load  
vmassol - (14:41): ok rights should be ok now  
sburjan - (14:41): Maven 3.0.1 is being tagged and prepared for release.  
vmassol - (14:41): jerome and I will fix them in the DB when we upgrade too  
vmassol - (14:42): sburjan: yes seen that  
sburjan - (14:42): vmassol: playground works.  
vmassol - (14:49): jvelociter: xe 2.6 snap will be built in about 30mn. Shall we try to upgrade then?  
sburjan left at 14:51 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
Enygma` left at 14:58 (Quit: Leaving.  
jvelociter - (15:06): vmassol: you want to do that to test the fix ?  
jvelociter - (15:06): otherwise I prefer to stay on 2.6  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 15:10  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 15:11  
Enygma` joined #xwiki at 15:27  
vmassol - (15:33): jvdrean: 2.6 is buggy  
vmassol - (15:34): there are tons of links to sister wikis  
vmassol - (15:34): in all syntaxes  
vmassol - (15:34): s/jvdrean/jvelociter  
jvelociter - (15:35): vmassol: OK. when is 2.6.1 planned?  
vmassol - (15:35): not planned  
vmassol - (15:35): this is just 2.6 with 2 bug fixes  
jvelociter - (15:35): ok then fine with me with the SNAPSHOTR  
jvelociter - (15:35): SNAPSHOT  
jvelociter - (15:35): but I'll do it tonight  
jvelociter - (15:36): I'd like to finish a couple of things first  
vmassol - (15:36): ok no pb  
spliffy - (15:50): mh, i'm trying to save a custom mapped document. i followed the custom mapping documentation and everything looks fine to me, but nothing happens. i'm getting no errors. do you have any pointers to more documentation?  
spliffy - (15:52): does the XClass have to have all properties defined in the mapping file?  
mflorea - (16:00): evalica, sdumitriu, rstavro: do you know why hX have overflow:hidden in colibri.css ? What's the purpose of overflow:hidden when the width/height are not specified?  
sdumitriu - (16:00): So that the underline doesn't go under floats  
evalica - (16:00): if you are refering to the Headers - I think is because of the floatingbox that contain toc, etc  
evalica - (16:01): and yes floatingboxes are floated  
mflorea - (16:03): why not have a specific rule for this case? i.e. when inside a floating box?  
sdumitriu - (16:03): No, not inside  
sdumitriu - (16:03): Next to  
sdumitriu - (16:04): Open http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise25  
mflorea - (16:04): I see..  
sdumitriu - (16:05): And disable overflow:hidden on Hx an Hx span  
sdumitriu - (16:05): The unferline goes over, not under the toc  
mflorea - (16:06): ok, makes sense. I'm going to overwrite this in RichTextArea.css because it makes headings uneditable in IE  
sdumitriu - (16:06): K  
sdumitriu - (16:07): I'm not sure it's needed for IE at all  
mflorea - (16:07): well, not uneditable but painful to edit anyway  
abusenius joined #xwiki at 16:12  
mflorea - (16:23): it seems that in toucan, the overflow:hidden on the span is the one that matters. In colibri, there is overflow:hidden only on the heading, and the only problem I see (on both IE and FF) si that there is no spacing between the end of the underline and the floating box. So the underline goes below the floating box. I'll overwrite the overflow:hidden in RichTextArea.css though to be safe.  
vmassol1 joined #xwiki at 16:23  
vmassol left at 16:24 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds  
cjdelisle - (16:36): sdumitriu, "[proposal] A different approach to filesystem attachment storage." WDYT?  
spliffy - (16:40): (filesystem attachment storage)++  
cjdelisle - (16:41): My proposed method means if you dump files into the right folder, they will show up as attached to the document, changes will be made to the db automatically.  
silviar1 left at 16:42 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
Enygma` left at 16:57 (Remote host closed the connection  
spliffy - (17:02): cjdelisle: sounds really great  
jvdrean left at 17:05 (Quit: Leaving.  
evalica left at 17:05 (Quit: Leaving.  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 17:08  
abusenius - (17:16): wtf? I haven't changed that group  
cjdelisle - (17:16): You must have changed it last.  
abusenius - (17:16): I'm not even logged in  
cjdelisle - (17:16): Pretty sure when a change is automatic it blames it on the last user.  
vmassol1 - (17:17): yep it's me  
abusenius - (17:17): it is a bug then  
vmassol1 - (17:17): yes  
vmassol1 - (17:20): hold on to your seat, I'm going to migrate users to xwiki syntax 2.0 on xwiki.org  
camaritei left #xwiki at 17:22  
cjdelisle - (17:24): watch xwikibot get klined for flooding...  
vmassol1 - (17:25): cjdelisle: it won't because XE is not fast enough  
vmassol1 - (17:25): (XE on xwiki.org that is)  
vmassol1 - (17:26): I guess I could have stopped the bot before doing this....  
vmassol1 - (17:26): it's probably almost over… if anyone is pissed let me know and I'll stop it now  
cjdelisle - (17:26): yeap. I guess freenode is pretty lax because that looks to be about at the pircbot's antiflood limit.  
vmassol1 - (17:28): ok stopping the bot for a while  
xwikibot joined #xwiki at 17:34  
kwoot - (17:35): wil ask again tomorrow. going home now.  
kwoot left at 17:35 (Client Quit  
sabageru left at 17:39 (Quit: Leaving.  
xwikibot joined #xwiki at 17:48  
vmassol1 - (17:58): I'm going to create a RelaseNotes space on xwiki.org for release notes  
vmassol1 - (17:58): jvelociter: the search is broken on xwiki.org. Could have been caused by what we did yesterday  
vmassol1 - (17:59): I'm starting a reubild of the index  
florinciu left at 17:59 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
jvelociter - (18:00): vmassol1: I don't see really how but might be  
jvelociter - (18:00): vmassol1: you've converted everything to syntax 2.0 or ?  
vmassol1 - (18:00): jvelociter: there were 2 threads accessing ocncurrently the same files  
vmassol1 - (18:00): jvelociter: nope there are still thousands of docs in syntax 1.0  
jvelociter - (18:00): ah yes  
vmassol1 - (18:02): it's really a pain now to move a page as the home of a new space....  
rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 18:04  
vmassol1 - (18:04): you have to: 1) create an empty page as the new home, 2) copy the page you wish to move over that new page and 3) delete the old page  
vmassol1 - (18:04): ah wait  
vmassol1 - (18:04): this is not going to work since it's doesn't rename links  
vmassol1 - (18:04): so you have to create a Dummy page  
vmassol1 - (18:04): to create the sapce  
vmassol1 - (18:04): do the rename  
vmassol1 - (18:04): and then delete that dummy page  
vmassol1 - (18:04): yuck  
vmassol1 - (18:06): I'm in a spam mood today.....  
vmassol1 - (18:07): so many releases.....  
lucaa - (18:07): vmassol1: so I shouldn't be worried that I see edits made by my user when I didn't touch a bit of that application... I am not hacked, yet  
xwikibot joined #xwiki at 18:18  
cjdelisle - (18:19): ram, disk load, cpu, heap space. would have been real interesting right when it started bogging out.

abusenius - (18:25): you mean http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-2580 and http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-2782 ?
